title: 113_hr2847
content: The Act titled "Wounded Warrior Service Dog Act of 2013" may be referred to as the Wounded Warrior K-9 Corps. The Wounded Warrior Service Dog Act of 2013, also known as the Wounded Warrior K-9 Corps, authorizes the establishment of the K-9 Companion Corps Program. This program provides grants to nonprofit organizations to assist in providing assistance dogs to covered members and veterans with disabilities such as blindness or visual impairment. The Wounded Warrior Service Dog Act of 2013 authorizes grants for nonprofit organizations to provide assistance dogs to covered members and veterans with disabilities such as blindness, loss of limb, paralysis, loss of hearing, traumatic brain injury, post-traumatic stress disorder, or other disabilities deemed appropriate by the Secretaries of Defense and Veterans Affairs. Recipients must elect for the grant to be a reimbursement for costs incurred in the program. Eligibility criteria apply for receiving the grant. To be eligible for a grant under the Wounded Warrior Service Dog Act of 2013, nonprofit organizations must submit an application to the Secretaries of Defense and Veterans Affairs. The application should include a proposal for evaluation and details on training, care for assistance dogs, and publicizing services. The eligibility criteria for a grant under the Wounded Warrior Service Dog Act of 2013 include the organization's expertise in breeding and training service dogs, commitment to high standards, humane treatment of animals, and experience working with military medical facilities. The Secretary will evaluate recipients based on these criteria. The Wounded Warrior Service Dog Act of 2013 allows recipients to use a portion of the funds for evaluating the effectiveness of grant activities. Definitions in the Act include "assistance dog" and "covered members and veterans." The Wounded Warrior Service Dog Act of 2013 authorizes $5,000,000 for fiscal years 2014 through 2018 to support covered members and veterans enrolled in the health care system.
